sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 21 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the use of 'will' and 'shall'

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: for expressing future actions and intentions. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: 'Will' Future Actions
sections.content: Use 'will' to express future actions, predictions, and intentions.
points: He will probably arrive by noon.

sections.title: 'Shall' Suggestions
sections.content: Use 'shall' to make suggestions or offers, primarily in British English
points: Shall we go to the cinema?
I shall help you with your homework.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'will' and 'shall':
points: Shall I bring some snacks to the party?
They will visit us during the summer

sections.title: Exercise - Possession Comparison
sections.content: Write sentences comparing possession using both 'have' and 'have got' For example:
points: I have a bike, but my brother has got a motorcycle.

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Address common mistakes related to the interchangeable use of 'will' and 'shall' in various contexts.
points: Correct: 'Shall' is appropriate for making suggestions or offers

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, 'will' and 'shall' are used for expressing future actions and making suggestions or offers. Pay attention to the context and formality.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'will and Shall' Practice using these modal verbs for future expressions, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
